data.title: Opinion: Dear Raj, I don’t quite agree with you on Paris '24 being the worst
data.meta_description: Dear Raj, As a preamble, let me say that everybody has their own experiences and perspectives and we are all subjective.
data.text:
I recently responded to well-known actor Raj Gopi (of Out of Bounds and Kandasamy fame, among others) regarding a comment he made on Facebook about the Paris Olympics being the worst on record.

I thought I would share this with readers because it sums up my thoughts on Paris ’24.

Dear Raj, As a preamble, let me say that everybody has their own experiences and perspectives and we are all subjective.

ALSO READ | Analysis | Beers and KFC not good options at Paris ’24

In my case, this my fourth Games and to me, these Games have had the best venues I’ve seen by far — Roland Garros, Stade de France and that amazing beach volleyball venue outside the Eiffel, the Champions Park and many more.

The transport and accessibility was great.

The entertainment better than any other city.

And it looks amazing with all these historic buildings, history and fan involvement.

And I have experienced the VIP and regular man-in-the-street sides. I’ve botched a few train stops, but that’s me.

ALSO READ | SA Polocrosse team earn World Cup with nail-biting win over Australia

And the weather’s currently as hot, if not hotter, than Durban.

The competition has been exceptional, with that amazing 100m (no race before with all competitors running under 10 seconds), the tennis (Novak’s final hurrah), golf (Scheffler’s come from behind is unparalleled) and Leon Marchant’s four golds.

Team SA has not fared well, but competition is tough and our guys have given it their all.

Even the French are very hospitable, contrary to what we were told. I have to think hard to fault them. Oh, yes food and drinks are expensive, but we knew that.

However, if you shop around you can find most things.

I’m literally having a breyani now at a Bangladeshi restaurant for about R180.

ALSO READ | Woman and her ‘ordinary’ horse steal the show at Dundee July

If I stayed in my hotel, an ordinary pizza would be R250 and a beer R200.

Also, I have cycled the Paris CBD easily with three 17-year-old nieces (yes, they’re triplets) and their dad — with no issues — to and from the Eiffel Tower (30km in one day).

To be honest, I haven’t seen any administrative glitches.

I know there’s controversy about boxer Imane Khelif, but let the international sports arbitration bodies or courts deal with this as there are lots of technicalities, and to be honest, I don’t trust the Russian IBA.

Also, extremist groups do look for controversy.

I’m pretty religious and if I scoured Paris, there would be many things I could criticise, but I realise that art and religion and politics don’t always mix.

ALSO READ | Analysis | If you don’t throw, then you won’t know

And especially in Paris, the city of enlightenment and radical thought.

So there you have it.

For me, Paris has been fantastic and great for the fans and athletes.

To me, that’s what counts.
